column4: When using modprobe (installed a new Ralink rt61 driver), where does Modprobe look for the driver? I have it in  /lib/modules/2.6.17-11-generic/kernel/drivers/net/wireless/rt61.ko, but when I do a modprobe rt61 it says FATAL: Module rt61 not found. I even tried modprobe  with full path to the rt61 file and it still says the same error message... is modprobe blind ? yes I did updatedb & and used locate to make sure the file was there..
yeah he does not have wide aspect ratio, i asked that already hehe
and I get 1024x768 on a 14.1 so... lol
